subject: Re: [junit] Re: DataSource-Webshpere (Junit Problem)
msgSnippet: I believe WebSphere Studio refers to the IDE.  You need to run the tests inside a servlet container. =jason
messageBody:
I believe WebSphere Studio refers to the IDE. You need to run the tests
inside a servlet container.

=jason

On Thu, 2003-10-02 at 14:47, safamack wrote:
> No I am running the test from within the Websphere Studio. It can run
> Junit tests.
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "PARDEY, CRAIG" <CRAIG.PARDEY@t...>
> wrote:
> >
> > How are you running the JUnit tests? Are they running in the
> application server (using Cactus)?
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: safamack [mailto:safamack@y...]
> > Sent: Thursday, October 02, 2003 2:09 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] DataSource-Webshpere (Junit Problem)
> >
> >
> > Hello Everyone:
> > Since I have received no reply, I assume my previous posting was
> not
> > clear. I try to be clearer with my problem.
> >
> > I have a method getConnection that uses a datasource to get a
> > connection from the connection buffer pool with the websphere
> > application server. I have some other methods that call this
> method.
> >
> > if those methods are called by a jsp or a servlet running on the
> > server then everything is fine. However, when any of those method
> are
> > called by a Junit method, then getConnection fails. I need to say
> > that my JUnit tests also reside within the same web application
> > workspace in wsad.
> >
> > If it comes to worst,I can write a getConnectionMock method that
> uses
> > a jdbc to get a connection but that means everytime I test my code,
> I
> > need to change the source code.
> >
> > Is there a way around it, I would really appreciate your replies in
> > advance.
> >
> > regards,
> >
